title: Spectral distribution of a double-well Duffing oscillator subject to a random force.
abstract: The power spectral density Q(w) for an electronic circuit model of the double-well Duffing oscillator, driven by Gaussian white noise, has been measured in the limit of very low damping. Three distinct maxima and a plateau region are found in Q(w), in excellent qualitative agreement with a recent theoretical prediction by Dykman and co-workers

        Spectral distribution of a double-well Duffing oscillator subject to a random force.</dc:title><dc:creator>

        QC Physics</dc:subject><dc:description>
        The power spectral density Q(w) for an electronic circuit model of the double-well Duffing oscillator, driven by Gaussian white noise, has been measured in the limit of very low damping. Three distinct maxima and a plateau region are found in Q(w), in excellent qualitative agreement with a recent theoretical prediction by Dykman and co-workers.</dc:description><dc:date>
